arts.ttl: 'Nobody gave them a chance' - Plymouth make 'history' with upset
arts.sum: Plymouth Argyle interim boss Kevin Nancekivell hopes their win at Brentford will help put his side's season back on track.

arts.ttl: Plymouth stun Brentford in FA Cup upset as Chelsea cruise through
arts.sum: Managerless Argyle, who are bottom of the Championship, triumphed away to the Bees, while Chelsea demolished Morecambe and Bournemouth hammered West Brom

arts.ttl: Wayne Rooney in surprise sun-kissed coaching comeback just two weeks after Plymouth sacking

arts.ttl: Frank rues ‘massively missed opportunity’ after Brentford’s cup exit
arts.sum: Thomas Frank admitted Brentford were guilty of “a massively missed opportunity” to progress in the FA Cup after they were knocked out by Championship strugglers Plymouth. Morgan Whittaker’s late goal gave the Pilgrims a 1-0 victory and a place in the fourth round. “Congratulations to Plymouth – they scored a really good goal and it […] The post Frank rues ‘massively missed opportunity’ after Brentford’s cup exit appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Kevin Nancekivell backs Plymouth to stay up if they replicate Brentford display
arts.sum: Argyle are bottom of the Championship.

arts.ttl: Plymouth stun Brentford in FA Cup giant-killing
arts.sum: Championship strugglers Plymouth Argyle produced an FA Cup giant-killing on Saturday as they stunned Premier League side Brentford in the third round.

arts.ttl: 'That will give them massive confidence' | Morrison believes Plymouth can get out of trouble
arts.sum: Clinton Morrison says if Plymouth show the level of performance that they did in their 1-0 FA Cup win over Brentford then they will be fine this season in the Championship.

arts.ttl: Plymouth stun Brentford with late winner
arts.sum: Watch highlights as the Championship's bottom club Plymouth Argyle find a late winner to knock Premier League side Brentford out of the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: Plymouth move on from Rooney with famous FA Cup shock at Brentford
arts.athr: Jonathan Wilson at the Gtech Community Stadium
arts.sum: They might have pulled the plug on the documentary a week too soon. It’s been a strange two weeks for Plymouth. First they sacked Wayne Rooney. Then, despite being managerless, they broke their transfer record to sign the Ghana international striker Michael Baidoo. Then they appointed the 42-year-old Austrian manager Miron Muslic to succeed Rooney. And then, to cap it all, with the interim duo of the first-team coach Kevin Nancekivell and the club captain Joe Edwards still in charge, they pulled off their most eye-catching result in years, Morgan Whittaker’s 82nd-minute goal giving them victory over Premier League Brentford. In the nine away games before Rooney was sacked, Plymouth’s run of results read: 0-2, 0-4, 0-2, 0-4, 1-6, 1-1, 0-3, 0-1, 0-5. “How shit must you be? We’re drawing away,” the away fans were singing within five seconds – a line in gallows humour that earned a discernible laugh form the home end. But this really didn’t look like a side that has conceded 35 goals in 14 away league games this season. Continue reading...
